metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10767 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel before 5.8-rc1 in the implementation of the Enhanced IBPB (Indirect Branch Prediction Barrier). The IBPB mitigation will be disabled when STIBP is not available or when the Enhanced Indirect Branch Restricted Speculation (IBRS) is available. This flaw allows a local attacker to perform a Spectre V2 style attack when this configuration is active. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality. It was discovered that the Linux kernel did not correctly apply Indirect Branch Predictor Barrier (IBPB) mitigations in certain situations. A local attacker could possibly use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-generic - 4.15.0-115.116
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-115-lowlatency - 4.15.0-115.116
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1080-aws - 4.15.0-1080.84
No subscription required

linux-image-5.3.0-1032-aws - 5.3.0-1032.34~18.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-115.116').
linux-aws package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1080.84').
linux-aws-5.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
